headline: Questions of Pedagogy
description: A sixteen-question prompt for educators and thinkers, designed to spark unguarded reflection about teaching, learning, ethics, and intellectual engagement. Equal parts diagnostic and philosophical mirror.
whyItMatters: This post distills the heart of your educational inquiry into a flexible, open form. It asks not for compliance, but awareness. The questions are seeds — for the reader, for the teacher, and for yourself.
articleExcerpt: 16 free-range questions. Take the answers wherever it goes.
sourceFragments: Do you think specific learning has to occur? For learning to occur?
How do you respect competing truths?
Is there a reason you do/don’t do presentations?
What is one thing all learners can do better?
